document_data.name: Rilsa Rael
document_data.mainbody:
'''Rilsa Rael''' was a crime lord of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. She was one of the high-ranking kingpins of [[the Guild]]. 

{{Quote|The people need the Guild to protect them from the city and from themselves.|Rilsa Rael.}}
document_data.Personality:
[[File:RilsaRael.jpg|thumb|left|250px|''Rilsa Rael, profile in ruthlessness.'']]
Rilsa thought that the [[Flaming Fists]] were callous and uncaring of the poor Baldurian citizens. She believed that the nobles and rich were all to blame for the terrible conditions of the inhabitants of the [[Outer City]] district.

She was known for loyalty to the Guild―more specifically its leader [[Astele Keene|Astele "Nine-Fingers" Keene]]―her creativity for problem-solving and underlying ruthlessness in all manners. Unlike her mistress, who maintained a respectful distance from all matters, Rilsa preferred to work personally with others in Guild business.
document_data.Activities:
In addition to her criminal activities, Rilsa ran the [[Calim Jewel Emporium]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Little Calimshan|Little Calimshan]] district. It was within that shop she held a form of open court, in order to truly hear the concerns of the people she watched over. She also oversaw a local called the [[Garden of Whispers]], a meeting place by which individuals or organizations could deal in secrets with ensure anonymity.

Among other deed, Rilsa orchestrated robberies of the wealthy in order to distribute their riches to the poor citizens of the Outer City.
document_data.Relationships:
She was the favored and most trusted individual among Nine-Fingers' lieutenants, known as the Lady's Court. As the Guild reached the apex of its power, Rilsa remained poised as the organization's heir apparent.

She had a good ally in [[Ettvard Needle]], operator of the [[Baldur's Mouth]] [[broadsheet]]. Needle held great respect for Rilsa and her dedication to the Baldurian's of the Outer City.
document_data.History:
{{Quote|In another time and another palce, RIlsa Rael would be celebrated as a revolutionary. In Baldur's Gate, in her own lifetime, she's known as a crime lord...|'"Excerpt from [[The Guild: Hidden Rulers of Baldur's Gate]].''}}
[[File:Rilsa Rael CLB.jpg|thumb|right|350px|''Rilsa Rael of Little Calimshan, c. [[1492 DR]].]]
When she was young, Rilsa's father was hung by soldiers of the Flaming Fist, and her mother became a courtesan to an influential member of the [[Nobility of Baldur's Gate|Baldurian nobility]]. Rilsa was left alone in the world when her mother was later imprisoned by her lover's spurned wife. To survive, the young Rilsa joined one of the street gangs in [[Baldur's Gate/Norchapel|Norchapel]].

During her rise to power, Rilsa Rael fully brought Little Calimshan under the influence of [[the Guild]]. 

In the {{YearlinkName|1482}}, Rilsa was involved in the crisis that culminated in the resurrection of [[Bhaal]].

Rilsa still held onto power over the the course of the following decade. By the {{YearlinkName|1492}} however, the [[Right Pashas]], a Calishite gang based in Little Calimshan, saw the Guild as an outsider group and fought to force the Guild out of what they saw as their territory. When the Guild entered a turf war against the [[Stone Lord]], a fierce warrior under the control of the [[Cult of the Absolute]], Rilsa Rael broke peace with the Pashas of Little Calimshan, after of of their leaders proclaimed Nine-Fingers' reign was over. The man claimed to know what the Guildmaster was thinking and how her downfall was inevitable. Rilsa Rael retaliated by cutting his finger off and mailing it to Nine-Fingers along with the note on what had happened. But Rilsa was sure that the headman of the Pashas now knew Nine-Fingers' mind a little better.
